String: Pfft, typical.||I spend all day stuffing roses and rabbits up my sleeves|and then I lose before I even get to use them.
String_di: Pfff, lo típico. Me paso todo el día escondiendo|flores y conejos bajo la manga y pierdo antes de|poder usarlos.

String: Oh no! I was aiming for 'magic', but this outcome is|closer to 'tragic'.
String_di: ¡Oh, no! Quería probar todos mis trucos, pero el resultado|para mí ha sido bastante truculento.

String: Zooooom! Boooom! That was spectacular!||Hey, if you make it out of here, say hello|to the moon for me.||I still think about it every day...
String_di: ¡Puuum! ¡Buuum! ¡Ha sido espectacular!||Eh, si consigues salir de aquí,|saluda a la luna de mi parte.||La echo de menos todos los días...

String: Bazaaaam, you're a star!||Ah, I loved the stars.
String_di: ¡Rayos y centellas, eres una estrella!||Ay, me encantaban las estrellas.

String: BAAAAM! I'm so proud of you!||I mean, you beat Lady Luck, of course you'll|have no problem beating me!
String_di: ¡BUUUM! ¡Estoy orgulloso de ti!||¡Está claro que, si puedes con Fortuna,|conmigo no tendrías ningún problema!

String: Honestly, everyone knows you shouldn't|use a vacuum to clean up dice.||A dust pan and brush, that's where it's at.
String_di: En serio, todo el mundo sabe que no|se debe usar una aspiradora para limpiar dados.|Recogedor y cepillo, eso es lo suyo.

String: Ugh! How embarassing.||If this gets back to the Roombas I'll never hear the end of it!
String_di: ¡Uf! Qué vergüenza.||¡Si las Roomba se enteran de esto, no habrá quien les cierre la boca!

String: Well, I'm running on my emergency battery!|What can you expect?
String_di: ¡Si es que estoy utilizando mi batería de emergencia!|¿Qué esperabas?

String: Don't you go poking around in my mushrooms!||It's taken me eighty-three years to get them this soggy!
String_di: ¡No me toquetees los champiñones! ¡Me ha llevado|ochenta y tres años conseguir que estén tan pastosos!

String: I wasn't even trying, you know.|Win if you want, I don't care.
String_di: Que sepas que ni me estaba esforzando.|Gana si quieres, no me importa.

String: I'm actually not bothered. And I didn't want to win anyway.
String_di: La verdad es que no me lo he tomado mal. Si ni siquiera quería ganar.

String: Well, aren't you a little tryhard.
String_di: Vaya, vaya, creo que te has picado un poco.

String: Pew! Pew-pew-pew pew!||I'll get you next time, you big dice!|BZZZT! Pew-pew-pew-pew!
String_di: ¡Piuw! ¡Piuw, piuw, piuw!||¡Para la próxima te gano, cabezadado!|¡BZZZ! ¡Piuw-piuw-piuw!

String: Pew PEW pew PEW pew PEW!||BZZZZZZZZZT!
String_di: ¡Piu PIU piu PIU piu PIU!||¡BZZZZZZZZZT!

String: Slup slup SLORP slurp!||SLORP slurp! SLUP!
String_di: ¡Ssshrp, ssshhrp, SLRRRP!||¡Ssshhrp, SLRRRP!|¡SLRRRP!

String: Slurp!||SLUUUUUUUURP!
String_di: ¡Ssshrp!||¡SLRRRRRRRRPPP!

String: Slup slup-slup slup!|Slup-slup slup slurp!||SLORP.
String_di: ¡Ssshrp, sshrp, sshrp!|¡Ssshrp, sshrp, sshrp!||SLRRP.

String: S-lurp lurp! Slup-p-purp!
String_di: ¡Ssshrp-slrrp! ¡Ssshrp-p-p-slrrrp!

String: Ugggh! I keep telling them|I need a bigger sword!
String_di: ¡Uf! ¡Ya les he dicho que necesito|una espada más grande!

String: Ugggh. I'll get you next time!||Hey, actually do you have any spare weapons I can borrow?
String_di: Argh. ¡La próxima vez te ganaré!||Eh, por cierto, ¿no te sobrará un arma que puedas prestarme?

String: Hey! Hey! Hey! If you see my|mum could you say hi to her?||She's like me but she's REALLY BIG|and her teeth are so sharp!
String_di: ¡Eh! ¡Eh! ¡Eh! Si ves a mi madre,|¿puedes saludarla de mi parte?||¡Es como yo, pero mucho MÁS GRANDE|y con dientes afiladísimos!

String: Hey! Hey! It's you! Can you give me a pat?||I promise I won't bite *all* your hand off!
String_di: ¡Eh! ¡Eh! ¡Eres tú! ¿Puedes rascarme las orejas?||¡Te prometo que no te morderé... toda la mano!

String: Oh you think you can beat TREES do you?|You feeling good?||The trees will WAIT and they will|EAT you when you're gone, mate.
String_di: ¡Así que piensas que puedes ir zurrando a los ÁRBOLES!|¿Te sientes mejor?||Los árboles estarán al ACECHO y te|COMERÁN a la primera de cambio, colega.

String: You can't hide from trees!||They live for hundreds of years! They feast on the dead!
String_di: ¡No puedes esconderte de los árboles!||¡Viven cientos de años! ¡Se alimentan de los cadáveres!

String: You think you're so smart, don't you? But|trees are the original vampire, mate.||They grow from dust and they FEED on your BLOOD.
String_di: Piensas que eres muy inteligente, ¿eh? Pero|los árboles son el vampiro original.||Crecen del polvo y se ALIMENTAN con tu SANGRE.

String: Aaaa, you win, that was so clever! It was so|much fun playing with you!||Please visit me again, I get so bored|and lonely here.
String_di: ¡Aaah, tú ganas, qué ingenio! ¡Me lo he|pasado genial jugando contigo!||Pásate otro día, porfa, me aburro|aquí tan solo.

String: That was such a good fight!||But not as good as when we all beat Lady Luck, that|was SO good! You're so brave and smart!
String_di: ¡Una pelea estupenda!||Pero no tan guay como cuando vencimos a Fortuna,|¡aquello fue GENIAL! ¡Admiro tu valentía e inteligencia!

String: Beat ya later, gladiator!
String_di: ¡Nos vemos luego, cabezajuego!

String: Ha ha, I'll just wait for you to lose,|and then I'll take *all* your gold.
String_di: ¡Ja, ja, ja! Voy a esperarme a que pierdas|y después te quitaré todo el oro.

String: *sighs* I had a really good potion coming up. What a waste.
String_di: En fin... Con la poción tan buena que tenía. Qué desperdicio.

String: Yet again the fight ends before I get to use my best stuff.|Honestly, these Dungeons.
String_di: Y otra vez termina el combate antes de poder usar mi mejor técnica.|Dichosas mazmorras.

String: This potion was going to blow your mind! Literally!||I only had to boil it for thirty more seconds|and it would have been perfect.
String_di: ¡Esta poción te va a volar la sesera! ¡Literalmente!||Solo tenía que haberla calentado otros treinta segundos|y habría estado perfecta.

String: Mua-ha-ha! You think because of one lucky fight|you can win the whole game? Not a chance!||Mua-ha-ha-harshmallow will get you next time!
String_di: ¡Mua, ja, ja! ¿Crees que puedes ganar este juego|porque has tenido un golpe de suerte? ¡De eso nada!||¡Mua, ja, ja, este Malvavisco volverá a por ti!

String: There's only room for *one* cube monster in|this dungeon, and it's mua-ha-harshmallow!
String_di: Solo hay sitio para un monstruo cubiforme en|esta mazmorra, ¡aquí manda Mua-ja-ja-jalvavisco!

String: Mua-ha-harshmallow isn't happy about this!||Just because you beat Lady Luck once doesn't|mean you can beat us all the time!
String_di: ¡A Mua-ja-ja-jalvavisco no le gusta esto!||¡Solo porque has vencido a Fortuna una vez no|significa que nos vas a ganar siempre!

String: Hey, I've got some super-comfy cushions|here if you want to crawl in for a nap...
String_di: Eh, ¿te apetece una siestecita? Métete, que|tengo unos cojines muy cómodos dentro...

String: Oh well done! But that fight must have taken it out of you.||Why not climb into this entirely non-suspicious|chest-shaped resting space and take a nap?
String_di: ¡Ah, un gran trabajo! Pero seguro que la pelea te ha agotado.||¿Por qué no te metes en este cómodo espacio|de descanso con forma de cofre y te echas una siesta?

String: Hey, rad fight!||I don't suppose you've got any cassettes with you|from literally any year after 1986?
String_di: ¡Ey, ha sido radical!||Imagino que no llevas encima ningún casete|de los que salieron a partir de 1986, ¿verdad?

String: Stupendous! Delightful!||I look forward to fighting you many more|times in our eternity together!
String_di: ¡Formidable! ¡Magnífico! ¡Espero luchar contigo|muchas más veces en esta eternidad compartida!

String: Splendid! Very convincing! You and your friends|are doing excellently, really excellently.
String_di: ¡Espléndido! ¡Muy convincente! Tú y tus amigos|lo estáis haciendo genialísimamente bien.

String: You continue to impress me with your hard work!||My congratulations on your victories, against|me and against Lady Luck.
String_di: ¡Sigues impresionándome con tu esfuerzo!||Enhorabuena por tus victorias contra mí|y contra Fortuna.

String: I wasn't always sneezy, you know.|I'm just allergic to dungeons.
String_di: Lo de los estornudos no me ha pasado siempre.|Es que las mazmorras me dan alergia.

String: Never mind the dungeon allergy,' I said.|'I'll bring antihistamines, I'll be fine,' I said.||But I ran out after a year. And I've been|here so much longer than that.
String_di: No le hagas caso a la alergia de la mazmorra, me dije.|Me traeré antihistamínicos, no me afectará, me dije.||Pero se me acabaron al cabo de un año. Y llevo aquí|muchísimo más tiempo.

String: Ah- ah- ahhhh-|...|...||Oh I hate it when the sneeze doesn't even arr- CHOO!
String_di: Ah, ah... ahhh-|...|...||Uf, no soporto cuando el estornudo se me cor- ¡ACHÍS!

String: okay cool, thanks for the fight or whatever|sideeye.gif||ugh, this place is the worst
String_di: vale guay, grax por la pelea y ese rollo|tusmuelas.jpg||uf, #EsteSitioEsUnAsco

String: #thisfightwasdumb #whatever #drama #whocares
String_di: #ascodepelea #yolo #drama #pasodeltema

String: I know you are, but what am I?
String_di: Sé lo que eres, pero ¿qué soy yo?

String: I'm rubber, you're glue. Bounces off|me and sticks to you!
String_di: Rebota, rebota. ¡Y en tu|culo explota!

String: Takes one to know one!
String_di: ¡Solo uno se conoce a sí mismo!

String: Oh, nicely done! Really solid fighting there!||You're going to make such a great minion once you lose!
String_di: ¡Oh, enhorabuena! ¡Qué pericia en el combate!||¡En cuanto pierdas, vas a ser un gran esbirro!

String: I'll be back! And I've got plenty more rocks|where those came from!||Which is here, in this underground|dungeon full of rocks!
String_di: ¡Volveré! ¡Y tendré un buen alijo|con más rocas y piedras!||¡Está aquí mismo, esta mazmorra|subterránea está llena de rocas!

String: Grrrrr! I'll get you next time, you|sneaky little cube.||Also hey look if you see my kid can you make|sure he's brushing his teeth?
String_di: ¡Grrr! A la próxima ya verás, pequeño cubo escurridizo.||Ah, y una cosa: si ves a mi cachorro, ¿podrías|recordarle que se cepille los dientes?

String: Amazing work! High five!||And again, and again - come on, keep|going till you've got all the hands!
String_di: ¡Un gran trabajo! ¡Choca esos cinco!||Choca otra, sí, sí, otra... ¡Venga,|hasta que termines con todas las manos!

String: Good on ya! Gimme thirty!
String_di: ¡Bien jugado! ¡Choca esos 30!

String: Awesome! Put it there! And here! Get two of your|buddies along and put it everywhere!
String_di: ¡Espléndido! ¡Chócala! ¡Y con la otra también! ¡Trae|a un par de amigos para poder chocarla al completo!

String: Good one! I love an old-fashioned flame war!
String_di: ¡Buena disputa! ¡Me encanta cuando la pelea|se pone candente!

String: Sick burn!
String_di: ¡Baja esos humos!

String: Now we're playin' with fire!
String_di: ¡Ahora sí que estamos jugando con fuego!

String: Ugh, what are you even doing here?||These dungeons *used* to be cool.
String_di: Hmm... ¿por qué has venido hasta aquí?||Lárgate de las mazmorras con viento fresco.

String: Ugh, I guess they'll let anyone be a contestant these days.
String_di: Uf, imagino que hoy en día dejan a cualquiera concursar.

String: Ugh, you only beat Lady Luck because we all helped you,|you know. You're not as special as you think.
String_di: Bah, solo has vencido a Fortuna porque te hemos|ayudado todos, que lo sepas. No eres tan especial como crees.

String: Grr! This is outrageous!||I was SLEEPETH below the UPPER DEEP|and you WOKE ME UP for THIS?
String_di: ¡Grr! ¡Qué desfachatez!||¡Llevo EONES dormido en las simas ABISALES|y me DESPIERTAS para ESTO!

String: I was WINNOWING with GIANT ARMS the SLUMBERING GREEN,|and you INTERRUPT me for YET ANOTHER fight?
String_di: ¡Estaba REPOSANDO mis TENTÁCULOS GIGANTES en las PROFUNDIDADES|y me INTERRUMPES para OTRA pelea!

String: And again! Again you barge in while I've|LAIN FOR AGES in UNINVADED SLEEP.||Not so uninvaded now! I hope you're|pleased with yourself!
String_di: ¡Otra vez! Otra vez te cuelas aquí y alteras|mi ETERNO REPOSO de SUEÑO INALTERABLE.||¡Pero ahora sí que me has alterado! ¿Te|parece bonito?

String: You WON and yet STILL you must wake me|for your IDEA of a FIGHT?||May HUGE SPONGES of MILLENNIAL GROWTH|AND HEIGHT consume you all!
String_di: ¿Me GANAS y aún SIGUES despertándome|con tus IDEAS de PELEA?||¡Ojalá unas ENORMES ESPONJAS MILENARIAS y GIGANTES|os consuman a todos!

String: CRYSTAL|C R Y S T A L||C    R    Y    S    T    A    L
String_di: CRISTAL|C R I S T A L||C    R    I    S    T    A    L

String: T O P A Z     J A S P E R    B L O O D S T O N E||A M E T H Y S T||A   M   E   T   H   Y    S   T
String_di: T O P A C I O J A S P E H E L I O T R O P O||A M A T I S T A||A M A T I S T A

String: Q|U||A|R||T|Z
String_di: C|U||A|R||Z|O

String: T U R Q U O I S E
String_di: T U R Q U E S A

String: Ah don't feel bad, mate! I'll just weave|myself back together again...
String_di: Venga, colegui, ¡no te sientas mal!|Solo tengo que recomponerme otra vez...

String: Maybe this time I'll weave myself longer legs!||Ah, it's great to be made of wicker, you should try it!
String_di: ¡Quizá para la próxima me ato unas piernas más largas!||¡Deberías probarlo, estar hecho de mimbre es la caña!

String: Hmm. Being a wicker man isn't working for me.||Maybe I'll try being a wicker golden retriever instead...
String_di: Mmm... Lo de ser un muñeco de mimbre no va conmigo.||Para la próxima intentaré ser una cesta de mimbre con perritos dentro...

String: Great that you're still around, mate!||Every fight's a chance to weave myself up again!|Gonna go for huuuuuge ears this time I reckon.
String_di: ¡Me alegro de que estés por aquí, colega!||¡Cada combate es una oportunidad para recomponerme!|Creo que para la próxima me buscaré unas orejas muy cañeras.

String: I love a good snowball fight, and|that really was pretty good.||Wanna stick around and make snow angels?
String_di: Me encantan las peleas de bolas de nieve,|¡y esta ha sido antológica!||¿Quieres venir conmigo y hacer ángeles|en el suelo nevado?

String: You know, my friends call me Frosty. I don't think|you're a friend yet... but maybe you could be?
String_di: Sí, mis amigos me llaman Frosty. Creo que|todavía no tenemos una amistad... pero podríamos intentarlo.

String: They say there's no business like snow business.
String_di: Parece que hay corriente, me ha dado un escalofrío.

String: Caw! Ca-caaaaw!||...Caw!
String_di: ¡Cruaaac-cruaaac!||... ¡Cruac!

String: Caw.||CAW.
String_di: Cruac.||CRUAC.

String: CAW. CAW. CAW.||Caw?
String_di: CRUAC. CRUAC. CRUAC.||¿Cruac?

String: CAAAAAW caw.||CAW!
String_di: CRUUUAC, cruac.||¡CRUAC!

String: Good fightin', high roller! I'll cook your goose next|time, don't you worry.
String_di: ¡Buen combate, cubilete! La próxima vez te|dejaré como un colador, ya verás.

String: Well, put it there, one-slinger!||You did it, and you lived to fight another day!||And when that day comes you'll lose for sure,|so don't you worry about ol' Cowboy.
String_di: ¡En esta mazmorra eres el jefe!||¡Lo has conseguido y has sobrevivido para ver un día más!||Y cuando llegue ese día, está claro que vas a perder,|así que no te preocupes por este viejo vaquero.

String: Welcome back, squartner! Good fighting, but I reckon I can|take you next time, you just wait and see.
String_di: ¡Bienvenido, cuatrero! Buena pelea, pero sé que|tengo el caballo ganador para la próxima, ya verás.

String: Take, then, thy victory!||Do with it what thou wilt in these underground realms,|for never wilt thou return to the surface!
String_di: ¡Maese rival, la victoria es suya! ¡Proceda como guste por este|reino subterráneo, pues nunca volverá a ver la luz del sol!

String: In truth, it would be undignified for a king to|fight as well as a simple adventurer.||Have thy moment of victory, thou wilt not have my crown!
String_di: Luchar como un simple aventurero sería|poco digno para un rey.||¡Disfruta de la victoria, maese dado, pero conservo mi corona!

String: Ah, mayhap I have lost, yet am I not still a king?||And in truth, thou hast won, yet art|thou not still a weird ugly dice?
String_di: Ah, tal vez he perdido... ¿Mas no sigo siendo el rey?||Y en verdad, pese a tu victoria, ¿no sigues|siendo un dado de horrible faz?

String: Thy victory is fleeting, and my majesty is eternal!|Thou shalt cower in terror yet!
String_di: Tu victoria es efímera, ¡mi majestuosidad es sempiterna!|¡Mi presencia inspira pavor en mis súbditos!

Fighter: Warlock (just translate *long sigh* and leave the rest in latin – it’s intentional)
String: *long sigh* Alea jacta est.
String_di: *suspiro profundo* Alea iacta est.

String: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
String_di: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

String_di: AAAAAAAA||AAAAAAAAAA

String_di: AAAAA||AAAAAA|AAAAAA||AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

String: It's not fair! It's not fair! I'm telling Lady Luck!
String_di: ¡No es justo! ¡Eso es trampa! ¡Me chivo a Fortuna!

String: Aaaaaaa, you cheated, I'm telling on you!||You're gonna be in so much trouble!
String_di: ¡Buaaah, has hecho trampa, voy a chivarme!||¡Te vas a meter en un lío!

String: I told Lady Luck you were still fighting and she said you were|going to get sent to detention! So there!
String_di: ¡Le he dicho a Fortuna que todavía estabas luchando|y me ha dicho que te iban a castigar! ¡Te chinchas!

String: Inside every adventurer is a skeleton|just waiting to get out.
String_di: Todo aventurero lleva dentro un esqueleto|esperando su momento para salir.

String: Your hapless flesh will fail you one day!||You can't rely on anything except bones!
String_di: ¡La carne es efímera y algún día la perderás!||¡En lo único en lo que se puede confiar es en los huesos!

String: I guess now that you've won we'll never find out|what a dice's skeleton looks like.
String_di: Supongo que como has ganado, nunca descubriremos|qué pinta tiene un esqueleto de dado.

String: Ugh, that sucks.||Well, adversity fuels art. I'll turn this into a song!
String_di: Uf, qué chasco.||Bueno, el fracaso es el camino al éxito. ¡Será la inspiración para mis canciones!

String: Ugh, I'll have to add this as an extra verse to the|song I wrote last time.
String_di: Uf, voy a tener que añadir esto en un verso|para la canción que escribí la última vez.

String: Hey, don't run off, take a flyer for my show, I'm|playing an open mic night next Tuesday...
String_di: Eh, no tan rápido, llévate un folleto de mi espectáculo,|tocaré el martes que viene, noche de entrada libre...

String: What, you're not even going to buy any cookies?||That's super rude!
String_di: ¿Cómo? ¿Que ni siquiera me compras galletas?||¡Qué falta de educación!

String: Hi, I'm Madison! I'm 12 years old and I'm|here to make sure you lose!
String_di: ¡Hola, soy Madison! ¡Tengo 12 años y me|encargaré de que pierdas!

String: You lose! That means you have to buy ALL my|cookies. It's the law.
String_di: ¡Has perdido! Así que tienes que comprarme|TODAS las galletas. Lo dice la ley.

String: Oh! That was great! You're great! You're a|*great* fighter! Can we do it again? || Wait, I'm tired now! Are you tired? |I'm tired! zzZZZzzZZZzzz
String_di: ¡Ah! ¡Ha sido genial! ¡Eres genial! ¡Eres|*genial* luchando! ¿Podemos repetir?||¡Espera, que ahora estoy cansado! ¿Tú no?|¡Yo sí que sí! zzZZZzzZZZzzz

String: Oh! Hello! Are you here to fight? Let's fight!||Who's a good fighter? I'm a good fighter!
String_di: ¡Ah! ¡Hola! ¿Vienes a luchar? ¡Pues luchemos!||¿Quién es tu luchador bonito? ¡Yo soy tu luchador bonito!

String: Oh! That was so good! Let's fight again one day!|Wait no I'm tired now. Are you tired? I'm tired!
String_di: ¡Vaya! ¡Ha estado genial! ¡Tenemos que repetirlo otro día!|No, no, ahora estoy cansado. ¿Y tú? ¡Que estoy cansado!

String: Ugh! Well, thanks for inspiring me to work harder.||I'll get you next time!
String_di: ¡Uf! Bueno, gracias por inspirarme a esforzarme más.||¡Para la próxima te gano!

String: Great to see you! Just a heads-up: I'm not gonna go|easy on you. I hope you've done your stretches!
String_di: ¡Un placer verte! Te voy avisando: No te lo|voy a poner fácil. ¡Espero que hayas calentado!

String: Bad luck there! Keep working hard! You'll make it one day!
String_di: ¡Ha sido mala suerte! ¡Sigue esforzándote a tope! ¡Tú puedes!

String: ...I won't make that mistake twice.
String_di: ... Este error no se volverá a repetir.

String: Hey. It's over, dice kid.
String_di: Eh. Se acabó, dado con patas.

String: Don't say I didn't warn you.
String_di: No digas que no te avisé.

String: Yeah well you look ridiculous and you're doomed anyway,|so I hope you're pleased with yourself.
String_di: En fin, tienes una pinta horrible y tu condena|te espera, así que al menos te llevas|esta alegría.

String: Yeah okay then, let's fight. I told everyone to go easy on you,|you know, I wanted to take you out myself.
String_di: Venga, vale, vamos a luchar. Les dije a todos que no se|pasarán contigo porque quería encargarme yo mismo de ti.

String: Ugh, that was hardly worth the trouble. Hopeless.
String_di: Bah, ni me he despeinado. Penoso.

String: So falls the injured hawk to the carrion vulture.||...||Way out's over there, no need to hang around|getting in the way all afternoon.
String_di: Y el águila herida cae frente al buitre carroñero.||...||El camino sigue por ahí, no tiene sentido|seguir entorpeciendo el sendero.

String: Ah, for the lost caress of the wind,|the call of the birds in the air.||Oh well. In the absence of any of that,|a fight'll do nicely.
String_di: Ah, el gozo de la caricia perdida en el viento|y el trino de los pájaros en el aire.||Vaya... Ante la ausencia de esas cosas,|acepto de buen grado este combate.

String: So the trees reach back to the sun, the tide comes in again,|and all is right with the world.||Buzz off then - game's over, loser.
String_di: Los árboles retoñan bajo el sol, la marea vuelve a la orilla|y el mundo sigue en perfecta armonía.||Largo de aquí, has perdido. Se terminó el juego.

String: Oh, sweetie, really? You're here to fight me again?|That is... so adorable.
String_di: Ay, encanto, ¿de verdad? ¿Has venido a luchar conmigo?|Qué... adorable.

String: What! No! That's impossible! ...you're going to|regret this, you little... pipsqueak.
String_di: ¿¡Cómo!? ¡No! ¡Es imposible! ... Te arrepentirás|de esto, insignificante... granuja.

String: Oh don't cry, sweetie, nobody can blame you for trying.||And you'll know better next time. Won't you?
String_di: Ay, no me llores, ricura, nadie puede decir que no lo has intentado.||Y así aprendes para la próxima vez. ¿A que sí?

String: Daaaa! Daaa! Da-doo! Bounce bounce!||I love it when you contestants win,|your victory song is so much fun!
String_di: ¡Duuum! ¡Duuum! ¡Du-du-duuum! ¡Pum, pum!||¡Me encanta cuando los participantes ganan,|la musiquilla de victoria es un temazo!

String: BOUNCE BOUNCE BOUNCE!||Yippeeee! You can do it!
String_di: ¡PUM, PUM, PUM!||¡Yupiii! ¡Tú puedes!

String: The poets don't write about... dice, you know.||Would *you* smell as sweet by any|other name? I rather think not.
String_di: Los poetas no escriben sobre... dados, claro.||Con otro nombre... ¿olerías tan dulce?|Me parece a mí que no.

String: Well, as the poet said, 'they are not long, the days of wine and roses'.|I don't believe he mentioned dice.
String_di: Bueno, ya lo dijo el poeta: No duran mucho tiempo, los días de vino y rosas.|De los dados creo que no dice nada.

String: 'O rose, thou art sick!', the poet said. He blamed an invisible|worm, but it turns out the problem was dice.
String_di: Estás enferma, ¡oh, rosa!, dijo el poeta. Le echó la culpa|a un gusano invisible, pero resulta que ha sido cosa del dado.

String: Well, gather ye roses while ye may, as the poet says.||You instead chose to gather your dice, and I can't say it|turned out to be an *entirely* terrible idea.
String_di: Bueno, coged las rosas mientras podáis, como dijo el poeta.||En su lugar has cogido los dados y no diría que|ha sido una idea TOTALMENTE horrible.

String: Oh, WHY can't I do better?|What am I doing wrong?||I'm not trained for this, I'm just a plant!
String_di: Ay, ¿por qué me sale tan mal?|¿Qué es lo que no hago bien?||Ni siquiera he entrenado, ¡solo soy una planta!

String: Oh, but I tried so hard!||I don't know what else I can do. I used a special gel|on my spikes but they won't grow any sharper.
String_di: ¡Ay, con lo que me he esforzado!||No sé qué más hacer. He usado un gel|especial en las espinas, pero no se afilan más.

String: Ohhh, I lose AGAIN. And nobody wants to give a cactus a|nice comforting hug!
String_di: Ay, pierdo OTRA VEZ. ¡Y nadie quiere darle un abracito|reconfortante a un cactus!

String: Thank you for visiting, it's so nice to see you!||Oh, I wish I could beat you just once, though.
String_di: ¡Gracias por la visita, qué alegría verte!||Aunque ojalá pudiera ganarte al menos una vez.

String: FEE. FI. FO. FICE. I SMELL THE BLOOD|OF A WALKING DICE.
String_di: PI. TI. TUS. PITITÁS. HUELO LA SANGRE|DE UN DADO CON PATITAS.

String: BE YOU ALIVE OR BE YOU DEAD I'LL ROLL|YOUR BONES TO MAKE MY BREAD.
String_di: GANES TÚ O GANE MI MENDA|AL FINAL TE DARÉ UNA TUNDA TREMENDA

String: HELLO, FRIEND. YOU WILL PERISH, BUT IT IS|GOOD TO SEE YOU AGAIN.
String_di: HOLA, ¿QUÉ TAL? ACABARÉ CONTIGO, PERO|SIEMPRE ME ALEGRO DE VER A UN AMIGO.

String: You haven't been here long yet, have you?||I can still smell the rain on you, I can see the last|glimpses of sunlight in your eyes.
String_di: No llevas mucho tiempo por aquí, ¿verdad?||Todavía puedo oler la lluvia en ti, veo|los últimos destellos del sol en tus ojos.

String: Was it cold when you entered the dungeons? Was there hail?|Are the snowstorms still looking for me?
String_di: ¿Hacía frío cuando entraste en las mazmorras? ¿Estaba granizando?|¿Las tormentas de nieve siguen buscándome?

String: A fair fight. I'm sorry you didn't get your hearts desire, but|at least you got to see the towering clouds again.
String_di: Una lucha justa. Siento que no consiguieras el anhelo de tu corazón,|pero al menos has podido ver las imponentes nubes de nuevo.

String: A crushing defeat - and yet still a thousand times more enjoyable|than anything which happened on X-av-5guu!||Your planet is remarkable!
String_di: Una derrota aplastante... Y, sin embargo, ¡mil veces más grata|que cualquier cosa que haya ocurrido en X-av-5guu!||¡Tu planeta es extraordinario!

String: Oh well! I'm very used to losing fights. On my home planet|of X-av-5guu I was bullied cruelly for wearing a monocle.||Here on earth, everyone is so surprised to|see an alien that they don't even notice.
String_di: ¡Ah, vaya! Estoy muy acostumbrado a perder combates. En mi planeta|natal, X-av-5guu, eran muy crueles conmigo por llevar monóculo.||En la Tierra, todos están tan fascinados por|ver un alienígena que ni se dan cuenta.

String: Another loss! I mourn it! If I won, Lady Luck was going to|let me taste ice cream for the very first time.||It is sweet, yet it is cold! Ridiculous! How can that be?
String_di: ¡Otra derrota! ¡Qué pena tan grande! Si hubiera ganado, Fortuna|me habría dejado probar el helado por primera vez.||¡Es dulce y frío a la vez! ¡Tremendo! ¿Cómo es posible?

String: Aye I'm far from the sea but a fella like me?||Though the ocean's apart I'm a pirate at heart!
String_di: ¡Arr! ¡Este viejo lobo de mar añora surcar las aguas!||¡El océano es mi patria, mi corazón de pirata!

String: A pirate cares nothing for 'win' or for 'lose'.|A pirate cares only for fighting and booze!
String_di: A un pirata le da igual ganar o perder.|¡A un pirata solo le preocupa luchar y beber!

String: See my beard! Ye admire it?|It's 'cos I'm a pirate!
String_di: ¡Mira qué barba! Admirable, que deleite.|¡Soy un pirata y tú solo grumete!

String: Arrrr, good to see ye back! Ye'll not find it easier just because|ye beat Lady Luck once, yer know...
String_di: Arr, ¡qué gusto verte, navegante! No te será más fácil solo porque|ya has vencido a Fortuna, piratilla...

String: Hey, hey, why is a dice like an apple?||THEY BOTH HAVE PIPS DO YOU SEE
String_di: Eh, eh, ¿en qué se parece un dado a una manzana?||EN QUE LOS DOS TIENEN CORAZÓN, ¿SABES?

String: Hey, why is a dice like an apple?||Because they both yearn to one day escape the Dicey Dungeons!
String_di: Eh, ¿en qué se parece un dado a una manzana?||¡En que los dos ansían escapar algún día de Dicey Dungeons!

String: Hey, why is a dice like an apple?||We both contain zero cholesterol.||Not everything is a joke, you know. Sometimes|it's good to learn a fact!
String_di: Eh, ¿en qué se parece un dado a una manzana?||En que los dos tenemos cero colesterol.||No todo son chistes, ¿vale? ¡A veces|viene bien aprender algo nuevo!

String: Hey, hey, why is a dice like an apple?||Because they're both vicious fighters that did equally well in|that fight just then, I think absoutely let's call that a draw.
String_di: Eh, ¿en qué se parece un dado a una manzana?||En que los dos son feroces guerreros que lo hacen|igual de bien en la pelea y creo que podemos darlo por empate.

String: (hee heee hee, the rocks will crush you and|you will perish here alone)
String_di: (Je, je, je, las rocas te aplastarán|y perecerás aquí en soledad)

String: (pleased with yourself?)||(hee hee, you may win one fight, but the stones of the|dungeons will weigh heavy on your soul for ever)
String_di: (¿Eso es todo?)||(je, je, je, puede que ganes la pelea, pero arrastrarás el peso|de los muros de las mazmorras en tu alma para siempre)

String: (heeee, you think you're going to win, don't you? But|the granite around you yearns to be your grave.)
String_di: (Je, je, jeee, crees que puedes ganar, ¿no? Pero|el granito que te rodea está destinado a ser tu tumba.)

String: (heeehee, you think because you won the game, you're free.)||(But you're never free of the weight of the earth and|the heft of the stones.)
String_di: (Je, je, jeee, crees que eres libre porque has ganado la partida.)||(Pero nunca te librarás del peso de la tierra|y la presión de estos muros.)

String: Ahhh! A new contestant!||Time to fire up the plasma blaster again!
String_di: ¡Ahhh! ¡Otro participante!||¡Hay que cargar el bláster de plasma otra vez!

String: Hey there, friend!||Your enthusiasm is adorable, but I'll let|you in on a secret:||It's time for you to die!
String_di: ¡Hola, colega!||Tu entusiasmo es adorable, pero te|voy a contar un secreto:||¡Ha llegado tu hora!

String: I could have sworn it was time for you to die!||Is my watch wrong? What time do you make it?
String_di: ¡Habría jurado que te había llegado la hora!||¿Tengo el reloj estropeado? ¿Qué hora llevas tú?

String: Oh, you're back!||Wait, that was another giant dice.||Well, you're all equally doomed so there's no|point getting to know your names.
String_di: ¡Anda, has vuelto!||Espera, eso fue otro dado gigante.||Bueno, estáis todos igual de condenados, así que|tiene sentido que me aprenda vuestros nombres.

String: Are you sure you're not dead?||I mean, this show has a pretty rigid format and|survival isn't usually part of it...
String_di: ¿Seguro que no he acabado contigo?||Es que, mira, el concurso tiene un formato ya establecido|y la supervivencia no suele ser parte del programa...

String: Hey, it's a dice enemy!||How are you getting on with the dungeons?|Feeling at home yet?||After all, it's not like you're ever gonna leave!
String_di: ¡En, un dado enemigo!||¿Cómo te las apañas por las mazmorras?|¿Ya te sientes como en casa?||Al fin y al cabo, ¡nunca vas a salir de aquí!

String: ...How are you doing this? It's like you believe|there's a way out or something!
String_di: ... ¿Cómo sigues tan a tope con esto? ¡Es como si pensaras|que tienes alguna forma de escapar o algo!

String: Hey, it's a little dice buddy!||Sorry, friend, it's definitely for real time to die.
String_di: ¡Eh, pero si es mi coleguita, el dado!||Lo siento, ha llegado la hora de morir, ahora sí que sí.

String: Y'know, you really remind me of me when I was a contestant.||But don't get your hopes up. It all seemed to be|going fine for me as well, at first.
String_di: Lo cierto es que me recuerdas a mí cuando concursaba.||Pero no te ilusiones. Al principio también|parecía que me iba todo bien.

String: What's going on with you dice, anyway?||Why are you still fighting?||Why haven't you been defeated yet?||This can't go on...
String_di: Pero bueno, ¿a qué se debe tanta fanfarria?||¿Por qué sigues luchando?||¿Por qué no te han derrotado aún?||Esto no puede seguir así...

String: Wow. Wow! I never lost this often!||You know what? Maybe you’ll do it.||Maybe you’ll win the whole thing, burn|the dungeons down. Why not?
String_di: Vaya. ¡Guau! ¡Nunca pierdo tantas veces!||¿Sabes qué? A lo mejor lo consigues.||A lo mejor lo superas todo y reduces|las mazmorras a cenizas. ¿Por qué no?

String: Look, I wish I didn't have to stop you.||But I don't have a choice.
String_di: Mira, ojalá no tuviera que detenerte.||Pero no tengo elección.

String: ...huh. Huh!||I was kinda joking before but... maybe you can really win this!||You could get your heart's desire AND get out of here…||… Yeah! You know what? You can!||And I'm coming with you!
String_di: ... Vaya. ¡Vaya, vaya!||Antes estaba de broma, pero... ¡A lo mejor ganas de verdad!||Podrías conseguir los anhelos de tu corazón Y salir de aquí...||... ¡Ya lo creo! ¿Sabes qué? ¡Tú puedes!||¡Y yo me voy contigo!

String: Yeah, get out of here then!||And don't you DARE pick my raspberries, they're|for ME and MY FRIENDS and NOT for thoughtless|adventurers!
When I have a big sword like I DESERVE then this|won't happen again! YOU JUST WAIT AND SEE.
Ah what a downer! Where's that mixtape I made to|play when everything goes wrong?||I hope I haven't lost it - that would make me|need it even more...
Good show! You and your chums really are making|stellar progress with this fighting lark!
Oh, another really neat fight!||I wasn't NEARLY this good back when I|was a contestant!||You're going to be a top-ranked minion in no time!
You think you're so great! But you know what?||You're not! ROCKS are great and they're gonna get ya!
Grrrrr, one day I'll beat you!||And hey, could you take another message to my kid?||Could you tell him to remember the Gardener is our|colleague and he's NOT allowed to eat him? Thanks!
It's great to see you again! Hey, has anyone shown|you the new staff room?
A terrible defeat! And yet I begrudge you nothing, because|the Earth food available in our new staff room is a|perpetual wonder to me!||I delight in your very presence!

Well. Another awful fight. I assume you're cheating.||But I've enrolled in our new training programme to prepare myself for|promotion to a superior Dungeon level, so at least I won't have to|put up with this nonsense for much longer.
Yeah fine, but when you're out in the world and hear a|gurgle in the drains, you watch out!||It could be me, ready to get you when you LEAST EXPECT IT...
You can act all high and mighty if you like, but I live in|the drains. I hear everything. I know EVERYONE's secrets.
Ah that was a good time, appreciate it!||And hey, not to be all corny but thanks for leadin' that|insurrection before, it's really made a difference!
Rock on! By which I mean I'm going to put a ROCK ON you!||But in, like, a friendly way because we're friends|now, right? RIGHT?
Oh, you again. I finally got some more antihistamines now|that we're allowed out of the Dungeons, so thanks I guess.||But now it turns out I'm allergic to them as well.|Ahhhh.... CHOO!
Ugggh. I'll get you next time!||Also DID YOU SEE MY NEW BIG SWORD!|IT'S SO BIG! I'M SO HAPPY!
WATCH OUT FOR THE PEAS!||You'd think the gardening would go better now that we've got a|skylight in, but that space marine just keeps coming to gaze up|at the moon and TRAMPLING them again!
Honestly given that you've already beaten the whole|dungeons, it'd be polite for you to lose a few more|fights here and there. Still, you do you I guess.
The souls of my enemies!
Defeating all who defy Lady Luck!
VICTORY

Fighter: Bestiary questions - Rotten Apple - Reason for entering the dungeons
String: Created here as part of a series of terrifying|biological experiments
Wow. Wow! I never lost this often!||You know what? You're not going to win,|but I'm glad you're trying.||You just stick at it. Burn the dungeons|down. Why not?

...huh. Huh!||I mean, you aren't going to win. You just aren't.||It's not possible.||But... maybe you could at least|get out of here?...||...|Yeah! You know what? You can!||Or at least, you can try! And I'm|coming with you!
...well. I thought I'd trapped you for eternity, but I see|you've been running around the Dungeons yet again.
I've come to get my friends.
And you've made some new ones?
Yeah, when I told them I was going to take you down|they were all really keen to join in.||You're not super popular around here, you know.
Oh, my dear.||I don't need popularity.||I have POWER.||As you're about to find out.
You don't like my rules?||Well, BAD LUCK, because it's time for some more!||MORE RULES FOR EVERYONE!

Well, look at that, you're still just about alive.||And I know how hard you've worked to get this far -|it almost seems a shame to end it all.||Oh wait, no it doesn't.||In fact it seems LONG OVERDUE and VERY|SATISFYING TO ME PERSONALLY.
I warned you that you were doomed, and|you didn't believe me!||Let's see if it starts to sink in over the|next millennium or four.||BACK IN THE DUNGEONS. ALL OF|YOU. FOR ETERNITY.
Nooooooooo! IMPOSSIBLE!
...|...|...and AMAZING.
I can do it! Just hold on!||We've come this far, I'm gonna get you|all, I promise!
I can make it!||But if you think I'm risking myself to come back and|get you lot, you're... you're...||...||UGH, I guess you're right. FINE.||Hold on, I'm gonna come and get you out!

Okay! Okay! I can do this!||You'll be okay, just wait for me!||Keep calm, remember those breathing|exercises I taught you.||AAAAA IT'S ALL DOWN TO ME WHAT DO I DO,|WHAT DO I DO?||BREATHE IN, 2, 3, 4! HOLD, 2, 3, 4!|OUT, 2, 3, 4!
I can make it! Right! Okay!||I THINK I've got the hang of how the Dungeons|work now, so just wait for me...||I'll get you as fast as I can...
I'm gonna get you!||I'm gonna fight my way through and I'm|gonna find you and then...||We're ALL GOING HOME!

Yes! I  can make it!||It's my turn to play the hero!||I'm coming to get you! All of you! And the Frog,|and Baby Squid, and EVERYONE.||We're gonna beat Lady Luck and we're|gonna LEAVE THE DUNGEONS!||Just you wait and see!
Well, if it isn't another dice!||Or wait, if it's only one of you,|is it 'douse'?|That sounds right. Anyway, welcome|to defeat, douse.
Welcome to the end of your journey!|Prepare to douse!
Hey, I looked it up and apparently 'douse' ISN'T the|singular of dice after all!||In modern usage 'dice' is both singular|and plural. Isn't that sweet!||Now: prepare to dice.
Oh, it's another dice!||Adorable! Which one are you?||No, don't tell me, I'm not going to remember,|honestly I was only asking to be polite.
Oh hello there! I've been thinking about what to|say if you turned up again.||I was workshopping something around 'DICE-truction',|but then I got bored of thinking about you.
You again! You might trick me once, but I|won't let you trick me, dice.
Welcome back, sweetie. Time to dice with death?|Hmm, no, just time to death some dice I think.
Hi! I'm Madison, and I only have one more fight to win|before I qualify for my 'Beating Dice Easily In|Boss Fights' badge!
Hey! I'm Madison, and I'm going to grow up|to be like Lady Luck!||...and in the meantime, I'm going to make|your day REALLY MISERABLE!
Oh HELLO! I was just writing in my diary and I|didn't have much to say about today...||But BEATING YOU TERRIBLY in a fight is|going to make a GREAT entry!
Honestly it's SO rude of you to keep trying to beat us|all like this when it's CLEAR you're never going|to get your heart's desire.
Hello! Would you like to buy some cookies?||Or would you rather I beat you in a big ol' fight?||Never mind, I know which one I'M in the mood for...
Before I came down to the dungeons I used|to get told off for fighting.||Now I'm the boss of a whole episode! So LET'S FIGHT.
Oh! Is it time for more fighting? I love fighting! Let's go!
Oh! I was asleep! But I can be awake!||Hello! Hello! I'm awake! Let's fight!
Oh! I was sleeping again!||It's so weird that you always come when I'm asleep!||Oh or maybe it's because I'm ALWAYS asleep?|Anyway, let's fight!
You're a dice! Hello! Hello! I love meeting dice!||DID YOU KNOW that DICE rhymes with NICE?||Maybe that's why you're a dice AND nice!|Let's fight!
Oh! Hey! Do you like sleeping or fighting more?||MY favourite thing is to fight IN MY DREAMS,|so I can do both at once!
Hey! Hey! It's me! I'm a good fighter!||Are you a good fighter? Let's find out!
Oh! Is it time for a nap or a fight?||I know! Let's have a fight and THEN a nap!
Oh! Oh! There's someone at the trapdoor! Quick!||Oh it's okay, it was you!||Are you here for a fight? I'm ready!
I've got to fight a walking dice?||I'm FOUR HUNDRED and SEVENTY SIX years old.||This is entirely beneath my dignity. But|I guess let's get it over with.
I can smell something. Have you been eating garlic?||It doesn't count if you win and|you've been eating garlic!
Back when I first became a vampire, the people who tried|to fight me would wear top hats and huge petticoats|and they'd come in big horse-drawn carriages.||But now: another big old walking dice.
Oh look, it's yet another dice come to fight me.||Well, good luck. I'm almost invulnerable and I'm five|centuries old, so fingers crossed for you I guess.

Oh, it's time for another fight, is it?||Well, I'll have you know that I accidentally ate some garlic|naan earlier so I'm NOT feeling myself, but fine!||If it's a fight you want then it's a fight you'll get.
The half-silent whisper of the underground night carried|news to me that you were nigh.||So I am entirely ready to beat you, just so you know.
The ethereal echoes of the cave speak to me of||your future, and they say:||You're about to die.
As fall the distant stars in the clear night sky,|so fall you in, you know...||...this fight that I'm about to beat you in.
When the dungeons deep beneath the earth|lie empty, and the moonlight shines into their|hollowed-out spaces...|...still will you be trapped here losing all|your fights like a loser.
Hey, I heard that eternity's blank eyes will see you|fall and falter and fall again. Starting now.
Deep below even these dungeons, the firey heart|of the earth awaits your inevitable failure.||So can we get started? Don't want to keep|the firey heart of the earth waiting.

Though the sweet river empties perpetually into the sea,|still is the sea itself filled with salt.||On a pretty similar note, it doesn't matter how|many times you come and fight me:||you're still going to lose.
Another fight? Yeah, go on then.
More fighting? I couldn't, I'm stuffed.||...|Ah okay, just one more.
Ooh, another fight? Don't mind if I do.
I swore I wasn't going to have a fight today, but|if you're going to leave it RIGHT THERE...
My dentist told me I shouldn't fight after|I've brushed my teeth.||So I fought her. I won, obviously.
I'm not really in the mood for fighting.||But if nobody else is going to take it...
Oh I've been in the mood for a big juicy fight all|day, and here you are. Perfect.
Oh, a fight? Honestly I couldn't, not an empty stomach.||Wait, no, I had some toast earlier so: YEAH|COME ON THEN LET'S GO.
Apparently I shouldn't be having more than|three or four fights a week.||So... you'd better make this one worth it.
One! Two! Three! Sword! And One! Two! Three! Shield!||Hope you've done all your drills!
Hey! You there! Believe in yourself!||You can do it! You can win!||Maybe not today, because I'm going to do my very|best to beat you, but... one day!
Ready for a fight? Yeah! Even if you don't|win it's good training!||Walk in strong, roll out stronger!
Yeah! It's fighting time! Remember: even if you lose, you're|still way ahead of the dice who aren't trying!
Yeah, it's you again! That's great! You're getting|better at this EVERY DAY.||And remember: you lose 100% of the fights you don't get into.
Hey, I'm so proud of you for sticking with this,|even when it's hard!||Remember: roll harder than yesterday if you|want a different tomorrow!
Yeah, it's time for another boss battle!||You been practicing? Let's get to it! Deep breaths,|centre yourself, and... FIGHT!
You're here again! That's great!|Every roll counts!||Remember: tomorrow's CAN is built on|today's CAN'T QUITE!

Wait, YOU'RE going up against Lady Luck?||YOU? You've barely been here five minutes!||What have YOU got to complain about?||I've been asking for better equipment for YEARS and nothing,|and now YOU think you're the one who's been wronged?||I'll show you!
WHAT. WHAT.||...|Hey um, if you DO manage to beat Lady Luck, could|you ask if I can get that sword upgrade I've been|asking for?||I could... I could come with you?|If that would help?
You AGAIN? Trampling on my tomatoes?||Not that they get enough sunlight to ripen down|here, but that's NOT THE POINT.||Perish, enemy!

...well. Well, I can't say I approve. But...||But if you're really going up against Lady Luck,|and you won't win but IF you do...||...could you get her to put a sunlight in?|I could... I could maybe help you?
Ugh, you AGAIN. Why can't I ever get a cool|opponent to fight?||You know your friends are all doomed, right?

...this is such a waste of time. You KEEP trying and|it's not going to get you ANYWHERE.||...|...|... Okay, look...||...I guess it's cool that you're going to try to take Lady Luck|down so I'm going to come with you.||But this DOESN'T mean you can tell|anyone we're hanging out.
Behold, nothing up my sleeves - except|your inevitable defeat!

Well. Very impressive.||Look, you don't... you don't need a magician|to help you out, do you?||I heard you're going up against Lady Luck, and there|are a few complaints from the rest of us that I|wouldn't mind raising with her...
Bzzzzt! Pew-pew-pew!||I thought you were all trapped for eternity,|but let's go, let's do this!||I'm ready! FIGHT. FIGHT. FIGHT. FIGHT.
WOOOOO what a fight! Pew pew pew!||I'm SO fired up now, I wanna come with|you and fight some more!

You again! Outrageous! I deserve better than this.||It's ridiculous that I'm still lounging around on|level one fighting STILL MORE DICE when I'm|MORE than ready to be a boss.||This is the last straw!||As soon as I've beaten you I'm going STRAIGHT to Lady Luck|and putting in a formal complaint!
Look. I don't like you. I never will.||...but if you're really going to take on Lady Luck,|I'm going to come with you.
SLUUuuuurp! Slup!
...slurp? Slorp? ...slorple?
Woah, you again!||I thought you were going to be imprisoned and sent|into minion training, but if you're here I'm always|up for another fight! BAZAAAAM!
Amazing! Congratulations!||...Hey, if you're here to fight Lady Luck, I'll be|keeping my fingers crossed for you.||And if you need some help, maybe...|maybe I could come?
Hey! Hey! It's you! You smell different!||OHHHH, because you're on a mission of vengeance|and rescue! That's great! Let's fight!
Hey! Hey! I like you!||Vengeance and rescue smells GREAT!||Can I come with you to fight Lady Luck?||I'll bite her! I'm so good at biting!

Aaaaa that was great!||Maybe you really CAN beat Lady Luck!||...I guess if you win, you'll be leaving?|I'll miss you!||It's been so much fun having you around!||...Would it be okay if I join in on the rest of|this episode? One last ride?

A... ... ...CHOO! Ugh, this SNEEZING.||...Look, is it okay if I come with you as well?|I'm SO sick of dungeons.||Literally: sick because of dungeons.||So if you're really trying to break everyone out|I wouldn't mind helping a little...
You think you're soooooo good just because|you're going to fight Lady Luck!||And you are. YOU ARE. I WOULD NEVER DARE.||LET ME FOLLOW YOU AND CARRY YOUR ROCKS.
Hey, you're off to fight Lady Luck, right?|Do you want a hand?||I mean, I've got so many of them...
Wow, so many of you!||All these bones all walking around together|in one place! Can I come?||I know some of you have flesh as well... but|I'll look past it for the sake of the BONES...
Why are you all walking around together, anyway?||Are you going on a road trip?|Can I come?||I LOVE songs about road trips, I'll bring my|guitar and we can sing as we walk...

...look, I know we're enemies, but I've|always admired your fightin'.||Can I ask a favour?||If you run into the Snowman, can you|give him a message for me?||Or... or you know what, never mind, I'm|comin' with you! Yeah! Why not!
